ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 110 05 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 110 05 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would definitely recommend portuguese 112 to another student. I would tell them that it is a super interesting and dynamic way to learn another language, as well as to learn about the culture of Brazil.

This is a great class! You learn a lot, but it is also really easy to do well in. Overall, it felt like a very natural and practical approach to learning language, as opposed to being a class where you just memorize obscure vocabulary lists.

The class is fine, but I would recommend taking another language, especially if you are not a native Spanish speaker. Be aware that if you are not a native speaker, the class may be detrimental to your Spanish skills. The class isn't much work and Marta is very laid back.
